intro: Adenophora polymorpha f. genuina, commonly known as the Korean bellflower, is a perennial herb native to Korea and northeastern China. It features upright, branching stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue to purple, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
